intro: Daucus gingidium subsp. hispanicus, commonly known as the Spanish cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. Its seeds are small and oval, often dispersed by wind, and it is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its aromatic foliage and flowers, it is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
